root.para: The most fundamental characteristic of every option is the uneven allocation of risk and reward. The holder of the option (the entity, in this case study) receives a larger potential gain than it does risk of loss. In this case study, the entityâ€™s profits on the option increase as the value of the foreign currency falls relative to the functional currency (U.S. dollars). However, if the value of the foreign currency rises relative to the functional currency, the entity simply will not exercise its option and can lose no more than the option premium it paid the writer.
